cab.content:
This Document is the Property of His Britannic Majesty's Government.
G.T.5938
SECRET.
BATTLE SITUATION - NOON - 11th OCTOBER, 1918.
1. WESTERN FRONT.
British Front.
On the LE CATEAU front there is no change in the general situation except that our troops are reported to have crossed the SELLE north of LE CATEAU.
West of SOLESNES the line runs from the RIVER SELLE north of ST. HILAIRE, north of AVESNES, thence as before.
North of the SCARPE our troops hold the DROCOURT - QUEANT line from VITRY to DROCOURT.
French Front.
East of ST.QUENTIN the line runs west of the OISE to LONGCHAMPS, thence west of AISONVILLE.
West of GRAND PRE the enemy are withdrawing and French troops are reported to be on the CHEMIN DES DAMES at COURTECON.
2. ITALIAN, BALKAN and MACEDONIAN FRONTS.
There is nothing to report.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
11th October, 1918.
Issued at 12.30 p.m.
